She explained she would hear noises, that turned into sounds, that turned into songs, complete with lyrics, bass, guitars and drums, like a radio, and the only way to "turn it off" was to write the songs down and play them.

name: COB
comments: Short-lived acoustic folk group that was formed while its members were living in Cornwall in the south-west of England. They were active members of a folk music scene whose main venue was the Folk Cottage in the village of Mitchell near Newquay. Their music often bore an eastern influence, with instrumentation that included balalaika and dulcitar (a dulcimer with a widened bridge, customised by band member John Bidwell), as well as banjo, clarinet and organ. The group made two albums in the early 1970s, both of which were produced by Ralph McTell . "COB" is short for "Clive's Original Band".

All of bands releases have been as this trio of the two Pfister "siblings" and Miss Schneider. The singing trio is mostly accompanied by the Jo Roloff Band = Johannes Roloff (piano), Jürgen "Speedy" Schäfer (double bass), Immo Hofmann (drums) and Andreas David (guitars).
